ranges.notes: Holiday atmosphere, many businesses closed, special Mass at Naples Cathedral (Duomo)
Gradually reopening businesses, Christmas decorations and nativity scenes still visible in San Gregorio Armeno
Holiday celebrating the 'good witch' who brings gifts to children, special events in Piazza del Plebiscito
Major shopping discounts throughout the city, especially along Via Toledo and in the Chiaia district
Traditional bonfires in some neighborhoods, marking the unofficial start of Carnival season
Quiet winter period, fewer tourists, excellent time for museum visits without crowds, especially at the Archaeological Museum
Romantic atmosphere in the city, special menus at restaurants, couples strolling along the waterfront Lungomare
Period before Lent with street celebrations in various neighborhoods, masquerade events, and traditional pastries like chiacchiere and sanguinaccio
Early spring weather, almond trees blooming, moderate crowds before Holy Week, ideal for exploring archaeological sites
Traditional zeppole di San Giuseppe (cream-filled pastries) in bakeries, street celebrations in various neighborhoods
Spring begins, increasing daylight hours, excellent time for exploring the historic center and underground archaeological sites
Significant religious processions throughout the historic center, particularly atmospheric in the Spanish Quarters and Sanità district
Perfect spring weather, blooming flowers in Capodimonte Park, excellent conditions for outdoor activities and day trips to nearby islands
Ideal spring weather, perfect for day trips to Pompeii, Herculaneum, or the Amalfi Coast before peak tourist season
National holiday on April 25th with parades, ceremonies, and some business closures
Ideal spring weather, perfect for outdoor exploration and dining along the Lungomare
Public holiday, many businesses closed but outdoor celebrations and concerts in Piazza del Plebiscito
Perfect spring weather, ideal for boat trips to Capri and Ischia, comfortable temperatures for exploring the city
Month-long cultural festival with special access to historic sites, guided tours, and cultural events throughout the city
First of three annual ceremonies where the blood of Naples' patron saint liquefies, major religious procession from the Cathedral
Wineries in surrounding areas like Campi Flegrei and Vesuvius open for tastings, excellent for day trips
Early summer weather, excellent for exploring outdoor sites and beaches
National holiday with celebrations in Piazza del Plebiscito and some business closures
Long daylight hours, perfect for evening strolls along the Lungomare and outdoor dining
International performing arts festival with events in historic venues throughout the city
Religious celebrations in various churches, particularly in the Sanità district
Outdoor performances in historic venues, concerts in piazzas, cultural events throughout the city
Religious festival with processions and the spectacular 'Burning of the Bell Tower' tradition on July 16
Peak summer heat, many locals head to coastal areas, good time for beach clubs and boat trips to islands
Peak summer heat, many locals away, some restaurant and shop closures, especially in residential neighborhoods
National holiday with widespread closures but special events at beach clubs and boat excursions operate for tourists
Continued heat and business closures; major tourist attractions remain open but city feels emptier of locals
Businesses begin to reopen as locals return from vacation
Perfect late summer weather, locals return, cultural activities resume, ideal visiting conditions
Naples' most important religious festival when the blood of the patron saint liquefies during a ceremony at the Cathedral
Ideal weather continues, perfect for exploring archaeological sites and taking day trips
Special access to historical sites and buildings normally closed to the public
Beautiful autumn weather, pleasant temperatures, ideal for sightseeing and outdoor exploration
Seasonal truffle, chestnut and mushroom events in surrounding areas, wine harvest events in nearby wine regions
Not traditionally celebrated but increasing popularity with events at clubs and restaurants, particularly in tourist areas
Public holiday, many businesses closed, special masses at major churches and cemetery visits
Traditional visits to cemeteries, special masses for the deceased, particularly atmospheric at the Fontanelle Cemetery
Autumn atmosphere, fewer tourists, excellent museum and indoor site visiting weather
Begin of the Christmas season preparation, artisans in San Gregorio Armeno busy creating nativity scenes
Pre-Christmas atmosphere, holiday decorations appearing throughout the city
Public holiday, start of Christmas season, lighting of city Christmas decorations, extremely busy in San Gregorio Armeno (nativity scene street)
Holiday markets and nativity scenes throughout the city, especially along San Gregorio Armeno, which becomes packed with visitors
Traditional celebration with special foods like pasta with breadcrumbs
Midnight Mass at Naples Cathedral, limited dining options but major hotels offer special meals, family-focused holiday
National holiday, continued celebrations, some businesses remain closed
Between Christmas and New Year's, festive atmosphere continues
Massive celebrations along the Lungomare and in Piazza del Plebiscito, fireworks over the Bay of Naples, concerts and outdoor parties

spring: Day Trips to Amalfi Coast Towns
autumn: Naples Archaeological Museum With Fewer Crowds
Posillipo Viewpoints with Clear Fall Air
winter: Winter Sales Shopping on Via Toledo
Day Trips to Less Crowded Pompeii

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
